messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/posts/{post}/comments` with method GET, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController.php`, `App\Http\Controllers\PostCommentController::index` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/posts/{post}/comments` with HTTP method GET.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Explanation:

- The route is registered in routes/web.php as Route::resource('posts.comments', PostCommentController::class)->only('index'), which generates the GET /posts/{post}/comments route.
- The controller method app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController::index(Post $post): View accepts a single route-model-bound Post parameter and does not read any query or body parameters.
- The Post model (app/Models/Post.php) overrides getRouteKeyName() to return 'slug' for normal (non-JSON) requests, so the route-model binding uses the post's slug as the path value for {post}.
- Therefore the endpoint has a single path parameter named "post" which is required and is a string (slug). No other parameters (query/body/header) are used by this web endpoint.

the final generated result begins
[
  {
    "name": "post",
    "in": "path",
    "required": true,
    "type": "string",
    "description": "Post route key (slug) used for route-model binding"
  }
]
